summary:
## Summary

The English Channel, also called "the Channel," is a part of the Atlantic Ocean between England and France. It's about 350 miles long and connects to the North Sea. It's the world's busiest shipping area. The Channel helped make Britain a powerful navy. It's narrower at the Strait of Dover (21 miles) and wider elsewhere (up to 150 miles). More people live on the English side. People speak English and French there.
title: English Channel
